The development over time of large-scale maternal and child nutrition programmes (e.g. as 
measured by growth or BMI) was significantly interrupted by a move towards micronutrient 
programmes, which were largely run outside mainstream maternal and child activities. For 
instance, iodized salt was usually a separate programme, and VAD was mainly addressed 
through intermittent high dose capsule distribution in child health campaigns and/or immunization
